other_tests.findings: Colonoscopy only revealed polyps and ascending colon diverticulosis. All polyps were benign and the one polyp removed from the cecum revealed adenoma.

Area of inflammation predominantly around the posterior cecum with multiple diverticula, diverticulum with hyperdense contents, inflamed appendix with mucosal hyperenhancement, and dilated appendiceal tip measuring up to 7 mm. Several prominent lymph nodes noted. No free fluid or free air identified.
